sen.j: 延慶両卿訴陳状（えんけいりょうきょうそちんじょう）は、延慶 (日本)4年（1311年）、勅撰和歌集の選者として京極為兼が擬せられると、二条為世がこれに反対して訴陳し、すると為兼はこれに反発し、為世がこれにさらに駁したものである。
sen.e: Enkei Ryokyo Sochinjo (The Petition by Two Nobles of the Enkei Era) records Tameyo NIJO's petition against the nomination of Tamekane KYOGOKU, in 1311, as the selector of an imperial anthology of waka poems, Tamekane's subsequent petition against the Tamayo's appeal, and this latter's further rebuttal against the former.

sen.j: 為世は、自分は二条流の嫡流で代々の歌書を相伝し、父祖に親しく学び正系を伝える。
sen.e: Tameyo claimed that being a legitimate heir of the Nijo style of waka poetry, he had inherited the books of poetics handed down from father to son in the family and studied the authentic tradition with his father and grandfather to embody it.

sen.e: He pointed out that there was no precedent in which an illegitimate child, which Tamekane was, had been appointed as the selector of an imperial anthology.

sen.e: Receiving Tameyo's petition, Tamekane rebutted each one of his claims.

sen.e: He argued that poetics had nothing to do with one's legitimacy or official court rank.

sen.e: This ended with Kanetsune's victory over Tameyo and he edited Gokuyo Wakashu (The Jewelled Leaves Collection) all by himself and recommended it to the emperor.
